summary: This document is an email chain from December 2020 discussing the approval process for a new client seeking therapy through the FBI Victim Services Division. The client is identified as a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails show internal FBI deliberation about the necessity and funding for her counseling, referencing a victims fund and questioning the timing of her request.

persons.name: M.S.
persons.context: A licensed psychotherapist certified in sexual abuse trauma who reached out to inform the FBI Victim Services Division that she will begin treating a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein', identified as the perpetrator of the victimization for which the new client is seeking therapy.

connections.description: M.S. is a psychotherapist offering treatment to a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled therapy session for Epstein victim
events.description: A therapy session was scheduled to begin for a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein, facilitated by psychotherapist M.S.

events.title: Initial therapy request forwarded
events.description: An email was forwarded regarding a new client (a confirmed Epstein victim) reaching out for therapy.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was processing a request for counseling for a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein in late 2020.
Internal FBI emails show deliberation about the approval process, funding sources (mentioning a 'victims fund'), and the timing of the victim's request for counseling.
A licensed psychotherapist, M.S., was scheduled to begin treatment for the victim on December 8, 2020.
